comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] This is in fact a representative of the (2nd) 48 class. (The original 48 class which were built as tank engines, and later converted to tender engines and formed the 23N-class and saw service in the Hunter region). 

The number is a little unclear but it looks like No 55  - if so it entered service in May 1874 and was withdrawn from service in 1892 having travelled 530,060 miles. The locomotive was imported from R Stephenson and Company and  erected by Mort and Company, Sydney.

Accordingly would suggest you change the caption to Class (2nd) 48 No 55 locomotive

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] Pssst State Records -- you haven't changed the caption yet. Should be "Class (2nd) 48 No 55 locomotive"
